alert.note: Alert for Southern Humboldt Interior (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 06 at 3:11AM PST until January 06 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: .Additional storm systems will bring moderate to at times heavy rainfall to the region over the next several days. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of northwest California, including the following areas, Southern Humboldt County. * WHEN...From 2 PM PST this afternoon through Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
